question: How many meaningful English words can be formed with the Second, fifth and seventh letters of the word "NEGOTIATION" (when counted from left to right) using each letter only once in each word?
solution:
The second, fifth and seventh letters of the word "NEGOTIATION" are E, T, A.

So, the words formed are EAT, TEA and ATE

Thus, three words are formed.

question: Each of the digits in the number 728152386 is arranged in descending order from right to left. The position of how many digits will remain unchanged as compared to that in the original number?
solution:
728152386

After arranging above number in descending order from right to left -

728152386
122356788

Three digits i.e. '2', '5' and '8' will remain unchanged as compared to that in the original number.

question:
Which of the following numbers will replace the question mark(?) in the given series?

42, 53, 69, 90, 116, 147, ?

Which letter-cluster will replace the question mark(?) to complete the given series?

YBP, WDO, UFN, SHM, QJL, OLK,?
solution:
A (1)B (2)C (3)D (4)E (5)F (6)G (7)H (8)I (9)J (10)K (11)L (12)M (13)
Z (26)Y (25)X (24)W (23)V (22)U (21)T (20)S (19)R (18)Q (17)P (16)O (15)N (14)
Y (25)B (2)P (16)YBP
Y - 2 = WB + 2 = DP - 1 = OWDO
W - 2 = UD +2 = FO - 1 = NUFN
U - 2 = SF + 2 = HN - 1 = MSHM
S - 2 = QH + 2 = JM - 1 = LQJL
Q - 2 = OJ + 2 = LL - 1 = KOLK
O - 2 = ML + 2 = NK - 1 = JMNJ

Thus, the answer is option (b).

question:
By interchanging the given two numbers(not digits), which of the following equations will be correct?

8 and 16

I. 64 ÷ 8 X 4 + 32 - 16 = 40

II. 95 - 72 ÷ 16 + 4 X 8 = 122
solution:
I. 64 ÷ 8 X 4 + 32 - 16 = 40

After Interchanging 8 and 16

64 ÷ 16 X 4 + 32 - 8 = 40

16 + 32 - 8 = 40

48 - 8 = 40

40 = 40

So, equation I is correct.

II. 95 - 72 ÷ 16 + 4 X 8 = 122

After Interchanging 8 and 16

95 - 72 ÷ 8 + 4 X 16 = 122

95 - 9 + 4 X 16 = 122

95 - 9 + 64 = 122

95 + 55 = 122

150 ≠ 122

So, equation II is incorrect.

Hence, only equation I is correct.

question:
Select the option that represents the letters which, when sequentially placed from left to right in the blanks below, will complete the letter series.

_ H M _ S _ A H _ P S Z _ H M _ S _
solution:
Option (a): HAPMZAS

H H M A S P A H M P S Z Z H M A S S

There is no pattern. So, option (a) is incorrect.

Option (b): APZMAPZ

A H M P S Z A H M P S Z A H M P S Z

Thus, the series is 'AHMPSZ' is repeating 3 times.

So, option (b) is correct.

Option (c): MPAHSZM

M H M P S A A H H P S Z S H M Z S M

There is no pattern. So, option (c) is incorrect.

Option (d): PSAHZMA

P H M S S A A H H P S Z Z H M M S A

There is no pattern. So, option (d) is incorrect.

question:
In this question, three statements are given, followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follows/follow from the statements.

Statements:

No Pearl is Stone

All Peach is Honey

Some Peach is Pearl

Conclusions

I. All Stone is Peach

II. Some Honey is Pearl
option_3: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_4: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
solution:
Statements:

No Pearl is Stone

All Peach is Honey

Some Peach is Pearl

All Stone is Peach: There IS no direct relation between Stone and Peach. So, conclusion I does not follows.

Some Honey is Pearl: All Peach is Honey. Some Peach is Pearl. Thus, some Honey is Pearl. So, conclusion II follows.

Hence, only conclusion II follows.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p26708/image011.png

question:
In this question, three statements are given, followed by three conclusions: I, II, and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follows/follow from the statements.

Statements:

Some Grid is Chart

Some Line is Graph

All Lines are Grid

Conclusions

I. Some Grid is Graph

II. No Line is Chart

III. Some Graph is Chart
option_2: Both conclusions II and III follow
option_4: Both conclusions I and III follow
solution:
Statements:

Some Grid is Chart

Some Line is Graph

All Lines are Grid

Some Grid is Graph: Some Line is Graph. All Lines are Grid. Thus, some Grid is Graph. So, conclusion I follows.

No Line is Chart: There is no direct relation between Line and Chart. So, conclusion II does not follows.

Some Graph is Chart: There is no direct relation between Graph and Chart. So, conclusion III does not follows.

Hence, only conclusion I follows.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p26708/image012.png

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.

[NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the number into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplication etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is NOT allowed].

[34, 5, 32]

[96, 6, 93]

The second number in the given number-pairs is obtained by performing certain mathematical operation(s) on the first number. The same operation(s) is/are followed in all the number-pairs except one. Find that odd number-pair.
solution:
Option (a): 14 x 4 + 4 = 56 + 4 = 60

Option (b): 53 x 4 + 4 = 212 + 4 = 216

Option (c): 46 x 4 + 4 = 184 + 4 = 188

Option (d): 35 x 4 + 4 = 140 + 4 = 144 NOT 145

So, option (d) is the odd number-pair.

question: A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a circle to play a game. They all are facing inside the centre of the table. Two people sit between A and G. D sits immediately right of G. F sits adjacent to H and C. E sits second to the right of C. B sits adjacent to G. Then, how many people sit between B and H, when counted to the right of B?
solution:
A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a circle to play a game. They all are facing inside the centre of the table. Two people sit between A and G. D sits immediately right of G. So, there are two possible cases, i.e., Case 1 and Case 2.

F sits adjacent to H and C. E sits second to the right of C. B sits adjacent to G. So, Case 2 will be invalid.

So, two people sit between B and H, when counted to the right of B.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits E.g.13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/deleting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

In a certain code language,

P ♪ Q means 'P is the son of Q'

P Φ Q means 'P is the maternal grandmother of Q'

P Ψ Q means 'P is the sister of Q'

P ¥ Q means 'P is the wife's brother of Q'

Based on the above, how is S related to W if 'S Φ T ♪ U Ψ V ¥ W'?
solution:
S Φ T ♪ U Ψ V ¥ W'

S Φ T means 'S is the maternal grandmother of T'

T ♪ U means 'T is the son of U'

U Ψ V means 'U is the sister of V'

V ¥ W means 'V is the wife's brother of W'

S is the wife's brother's mother of W.

question:
Three different positions of the same dice are shown, the six faces of which are marked as AB, CD, EF, GH, IJ and KL. Select the face that will be on the face opposite to the one showing 'GH'.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p21012/image030.jpg
solution:
Here, the face having 'IJ' is adjacent to the faces having EF, CD and AB.

Thus, the face having 'IJ' is not opposite to the face having EF, CD and AB.

So, the face having 'IJ' can be opposite to the face having GH and KL.

But the face having GH is adjacent to face having KL.

So, the face having GH is opposite to the face having IJ.

question:
Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.

?, 4, 180, 12, 720, 36, 1440
solution:
Here, the pattern is:

The alternate numbers are considered:

(a) 4, 12, 36.

4*3= 12 and 12*3 = 36.

(b) ?, 180, 720, 1440

Thus, 1440/2= 720; 720/4= 180 and 180/6= 30.

Figure II: 2 lies opposite to 5; 4 lies opposite to 3; 1 lies opposite to 6. Thus 2 is not opposite to 5. So, this is incorrect figure.

Figure III: 2 lies opposite to 1; 4 lies opposite 5; 6 lies opposite to 3. Thus 6 is not opposite to 3. So, this is incorrect figure.

Figure IV: 6 lies opposite to 3; 4 lies opposite to 2; 5 lies opposite to 1. Thus 4 is not opposite to 2. So, this is incorrect figure.

question: Under the provisions of which Article of the Constitution of India the Bharat Ratna Award can NOT be used as a prefix or suffix to the recipient's name?
solution:
Article 18 pertains to Abolition of titles - No title, not being a military or academic distinction, shall be conferred by the State No citizen of India shall accept any title from any foreign State No person who is not a citizen of India shall, while he holds any office of profit or trust under the State, accept without the consent of the President any title from any foreign State No person holding any office of profit or trust under the State shall, without the consent of the President, accept any present, emolument, or office of any kind from or under any foreign State Right to Freedom.

Further insights:

Article 17 - Abolition of Untouchability.

Article 17 of the Indian Constitution abolishes untouchability and forbids its practice in any form. It declares that "untouchability" is abolished and that its practice in any form is punishable by law.

Article 16 - Equality of Opportunity in Public Employment.

Article 16 ensures equality of opportunity in matters of public employment. It states that there shall be no discrimination against any citizen on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, descent, place of birth, or residence when it comes to employment or office under the State.

Article 19 guarantees six fundamental freedoms to all citizens of India:

-Freedom of speech and expression

-Freedom to assemble peacefully and without arms

-Freedom to form associations or unions

-Freedom to move freely throughout the territory of India

-Freedom to reside and settle in any part of the territory of India

-Freedom to practice any profession, or to carry on any occupation, trade, or business

question: Which state has the lowest female sex ratio as per 2011 census?
solution:
· According to the 2011 Census, Haryana has the lowest female sex ratio.

· The number of females per 1000 males in Haryana in 2011 stands at 879 followed by Jammu and Kashmir (889 female) and Punjab (895 females).

· The other two worst-performing states are Uttar Pradesh (912 females) and Bihar (918 females).

question: Which Fiver Year Plan was Focused on the Highest priority of Industrialisation?
solution: The Second Five-Year plan accorded highest priority to Industrialisation. The plan was based on famous Mahalanobis Model. Mahalanobis model set out the task of establishing basic and capital goods industries on a large scale to create a strong base for the industrial development. The plan includes substantial investment in the Iron and Steel, Coal, Heavy engineering, Machine building, Heavy Chemicals and Cement Industries of basic importance.

question: The folk dance Bhortal originated and is associated with which part of India?
solution: Bhortal is associated with the state of Assam in North-East India. Bhor Tal Nritya is an extension of Sankari culture. Six to ten dancers equipped with cymbols perform this dance to the first bit of '7hiya Nom" and produces a good number of attractive formations displaying the cymbols. The dance can be seen during festive occasions in and around Barpeta and Guwahati.

question: Subansiri River is the tributary of the which of the following river?
solution:
Subansiri River is a major tributary of the Brahmaputra River in the northeastern part of India.

The left bank tributaries of the Brahmaputra include the Teesta, Dibang, Subansiri, Kameng, and Manas. On the right bank, the Brahmaputra receives the Beki, Lohit, Dihang (Siang), and Sankosh rivers.

Further insights:

Ganga (Ganges):

The major left bank tributaries of the Ganga include the Yamuna, Gandak, Kosi, Sone, and Bhagirathi-Hooghly (a distributary of the Ganga itself). The right bank tributaries are the Ramganga, Ghaghara (Karnali), Mahananda, Tungabhadra, Chunar, and Damodar.

Yamuna:

The left bank tributaries of the Yamuna include the Tungabhadra, Betwa, Chambal, Sindh, and Ken. The right bank tributaries are the Hindon, Rind, Sengar, and Ganga (before its confluence with the Yamuna).

Narmada:

The left bank tributaries of the Narmada include the Kolar, Tawa, Banegaon, and Purna. The right bank tributaries are the Mahi, Hiran, Karjan, and Ganjal.

question: Identify the committee that is associated with the Electoral Reforms in India.
solution:
Dinesh Goswami Committee is associated with the electoral reforms in India, created in 1990. Some of the major recommendations made by the committee are:

• Change in the voting system n shifting to the proportional representation of the list system.

• Fresh delimitation on the basis of 1981 census n there should be the provision of rotation of reserved seats for SCs n STs, etc.

Further insights:

Balwant Rai Mehta Committee (1957): This committee focused on the reorganization of state finances in India. It recommended a three-tier system of Panchayati Raj (local self-government) with Gram Panchayats at the village level, Panchayat Samitis at the block level, and Zilla Parishads at the district level.

Ashoka Mehta Committee (1977): This committee also dealt with Panchayati Raj and suggested a two-tier system with Gram Panchayats and Taluka Panchayats. It emphasized decentralization of power and financial resources to the grassroots level.

J.S. Verma Committee (1997): This committee was set up to review criminal law in India, particularly in relation to sexual offenses. It recommended several amendments to the Indian Penal Code and Code of Criminal Procedure, including stricter punishments for sexual assault and measures to protect the rights of victims.

question: 'Squids' belong to which of the following kingdom?
solution: Mollusca is one of the most diverse groups of animals on the planet, with at least 50,000 living species (and more likely around 200,000). It includes such familiar organisms as snails, octopuses, squid, clams, scallops, oysters, and chitons. Molluscs are a clade of organisms that all have soft bodies which typically have a "head" and a "foot" region.

question: In February 2024, Indian musician Shankar Mahadevan and Zakir Hussain's fusion band 'Shakti' bagged the 'Best Global Music Album' award at the Grammy Awards for their latest album ________.
solution:
Indian musician Shankar Mahadevan and Zakir Hussain's fusion band 'Shakti' bagged the 'Best Global Music Album' award at the Grammy Awards. Shakti band received the award for their latest album, 'This Moment'.

The fusion band Shakti features vocalist Shankar Mahadevan, John McLaughlin, percussionist V Selvaganesh, Zakir Hussain, and violinist Ganesh Rajagopalan. The Grammy Awards took place at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles on February 5.

question: Who among the following was the founder of the Indore gharana?
solution:
Ustad Amir Khan (1912-1974) was the founder of the Indore gharana. He was born into a family of musicians in Indore. His father was a sarangi and veena player at the court of the Holkars. His grandfather was a singer at the court of Mughal Emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar.

He was initially trained by his father in sarangi. However his interest in singing led to him being trained in the merukhand technique (the use of permutations of any given group of swars). He soon developed his own style of gayaki (vocal style). The Indore gharana that he founded is known for its blend of the dhrupad with the khayal. Amir Khan is known for his three-octave range voice.

question: Kaundinya Wildlife Sanctuary is located in:
solution: Kaundinya Wildlife Sanctuary is a wildlife sanctuary and an elephant reserve situated in Andhra Pradesh, India. It is the only sanctuary in Andhra Pradesh with a population of Asian elephants, which migrated after 200 years from neighboring regions.

question: Which among the following is at the bottom of the Energy Pyramid of an ecosystem?
solution:
The sun is the ultimate source of energy. In an ecosystem, the greatest energy is stored at the producer level.

Producers can trap only about 1% of the available radiant energy. Only a small amount (about 10%) of the stored energy is transferred to each level of consumers. This loss of usable energy is represented in a Pyramid of Energy.

Source: Conceptdraw.com


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p9853/image001.png

question: Who was the Rajput king who fought against the invading armies of Mahmud of Ghori?
solution:
The first battle of Tarain was fought between Mohammed Ghori and the Indian Rajput King Prithviraj Chauhan in 1191 A.D. at Tarrain near the present day Thaneshwar city in Haryana.

Prithviraj Chauhan won the battle. However, it was after defeating the Rajput King at the second battle of Tarrain in 1192 A.D that Mohammed Ghori was able to gain foot-hold in Northern India and thereby establish the Muslim rule.

After crossing the Khyber Pass, Ghori reached the North Western part of India, the present day Punjab, and attacked and captured the fortress of Bathinda which was the outpost of the Rajput kingdom.

question: Koderma Gaya - Hazaribagh belt of Jharkhand is rich in
solution:
Mica deposits are found in the northern edge of the Chota Nagpur plateau. Koderma Gaya - Hazaribagh belt of Jharkhand is the leading producer.

In Rajasthan, the major mica producing area is around Ajmer. Nellore mica belt of Andhra Pradesh is also an important producer in the country.

question: Who was the first Indian to win triple jump gold at the Commonwealth Games?
solution: India's Eldhose Paul scripted history by winning the first-ever gold medal in Men's Triple Jump at the Commonwealth Games 2022.Paul produced his best effort of 17.03m in his third attempt while Aboobacker was not behind much as he finished at 17.02m, which he managed in his fifth attempt.

question: If RBI increases the statutory liquidity ratio, what will happen to the credit creation?
option_4: Initially increases and then decrease rapidly
solution:
· Statutory Liquidity Ratio or SLR is a minimum percentage of deposits that a commercial bank has to maintain in the form of liquid cash, gold or other securities.

· It is basically the reserve requirement that banks are expected to keep before offering credit to customers.

· These are not reserved with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), but with banks themselves.

· The SLR is fixed by the RBI.

· CRR (Cash Reserve Ratio) and SLR have been the traditional tools of the central bank's monetary policy to control credit growth, flow of liquidity and inflation in the economy.

· If RBI increases the statutory liquidity ratio, banks have to keep more money with them. Hence, less money is available with banks for lending i.e. credit creation decreases.

question: Jabalpur, Bhopal and Kota division come under which railway zone of India?
solution:
Jabalpur, Bhopal and Kota come under West Central Railway with Jabalpur as the Zonal Headquarter.

Other zones and divisions:

Eastern Railway Zone - Howrah, Sealdah, Malda, Asansol, Chitaranjan, Kolkata Metro

Western - BCT, Vadodara, Ahmedabad, Ratlam, Rajkot, Bhavnagar

South East Central - Bilaspur, Nagpur, Raipur

question: Which of the following Article talks about the Governor reserving the Bill for the consideration of the President?
solution:
Article 200 in the Constitution Of India talks about the Assent to Bills.

When a Bill has been passed by the Legislative Assembly of a State or, in the case of a State having a Legislative Council, has been passed by both Houses of the Legislature of the State, it shall be presented to the Governor and the Governor shall declare either that he assents to the Bill or that he withholds assent therefrom or that he reserves the Bill for the consideration of the President.

Further insights:

- Article 108 deals with the procedure for the joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament (Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha) in case of a disagreement on a Bill.

- Article 90 deals with the resignation of the Speaker of the Lok Sabha. According to this article, the Speaker can resign by writing a letter to the Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.

- Article 150 mandates the form of accounts of the Union and State Governments. It states that the accounts of the government must be kept in such a manner as prescribed by law.

question: In the reign of Alauddin Khilji, the term "Amils" refers to
option_2: Khurasani and Multani traders of foodgrains
option_4: Officer in charge of foreign affairs
solution:
In the reign of Alauddin Khilji (1296 - 1316 A.D.), the Amils were the government agents of the State. They were responsible for collecting the revenue and for this they took the help of local chiefs - the muqaddams and khuts. Land revenue was collected in kind, and the collected food grains were transported to the towns.

The policy of direct collection of land revenue by the State, based on measurement, could only succeed if the Amils and other local officials were honest. Although Alauddin had given these elements sufficient salaries to enable them to live in comfort, he insisted that their accounts should be audited strictly. For small defaults, they would be beaten and sent to prison.

question: Justice Sanjiv Khanna succeeded Justice D.Y. Chandrachud as the ______Chief Justice of India.
solution:
Justice Sanjiv Khanna is the 51st Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of India.

He succeeded Justice D.Y. Chandrachud, who retired on November 10, 2024 and his term will last until May 13, 2025

He was elevated to the Supreme Court of India on 18th January, 2019 and presently, he is the Patron-in-Chief, National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) and Chairperson, National Judicial Academy, Bhopal (NJA).

question: Saikuti Zai (songs of Saikuti) is from which of the following state?
solution: Saikuti Zai (songs of Saikuti) is from Mizoram. Mizo are traditionally known as a 'singing tribe'. The regional folk songs of Mizoram constitute the richest heritage of Mizos. Saikuti, a poetess of Mizoram composed songs in praise of warriors, brave hunters, young men aspiring to be great warriors and hunters etc.

question: In February 2024, who won the Chennai Open ATP Challenger finale?
solution: In the Tennis Chennai Open ATP Challenger finale, India's top-ranked Sumit Nagal emerged victorious and won his 5th Challenger Title. He defeated Luca Nardi of Italy in the clash by 6-1 and 6-4. With this, he enters the Top 100 in next week's ATP Rankings. The second-seeded Nagal will be the first Indian man since Prajnesh Gunneswaran in 2019 to breach the top-100 barrier. The Chennai Open is the first in series of ATP Challenger 100 events to be held in India.

question: Who was the first Indian to join the Viceroy 's Executive Council?
solution:
Satyendra Prasad Sinha was the first Indian to hold the offices of Governor of Bihar and Orissa, Advocate-General of Bengal, member of the Viceroy's Executive Council, and member of the British Ministry. The names Satyendra Prasanno Sinha and Satyendra Prasad Sinha have also been used to refer to him.

He was appointed in 1861 as as the first Indian member of the Executive Council of the Viceroy of India during Lord Canning's tenure.

question: In October 1938, who among the following set up the National Planning Committee (NPC) and requested Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru to become its Chairman?
solution: Meghnad Saha persuaded Subhas Chandra Bose, the president of the Indian National Congress, to create the National Planning Committee to scientifically plan the nation's reconstruction. In October 1938, Subhas Chandra Bose, set up the National Planning Committee (NPC) and requested Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru to become its Chairman.

question: Which element is located in Group 1 and Period 2 of the periodic table?
solution:
The periodic table is organized based on the electronic structure of atoms, and elements with similar chemical properties are grouped together. In this context:

· Group 1 elements are known as alkali metals. They have one electron in their outermost shell and are highly reactive.

· Period 2 refers to the second horizontal row of the periodic table.

Lithium (Li) is in Group 1 and Period 2. It has atomic number 3, and it is the first element in the alkali metal group.

question: Veto Power of the President allows him to ____________.
option_4: withhold his assent to the bills
solution:
The President can assent or withhold his assent to a Bill (veto power) or he can return a Bill, other than a Money Bill, for reconsideration.

If the Bill is again passed by the Houses, with or without amendment made by the President, he shall not withhold assent there from. But, when a Bill amending the Constitution passed by each House with the requisite majority is presented to the President, he shall give his assent thereto.

A Bill becomes an Act of Parliament after being passed by both the Houses of Parliament and assented to by the President.

question:
Table given below shows the male and female population of a state (in Cr) in different years.
Years201120122013201420152016
Male population (Cr)8131117910
Female population (Cr)5176111114

As per the data given above, in which years difference between male and female population is less than 4 Cr?
solution:
Difference between male and female population in 2011 = 8 - 5 = 3 Cr

Difference between male and female population in 2012 = 17 - 13 = 4 Cr

Difference between male and female population in 2013 = 11 - 6 = 5 Cr

Difference between male and female population in 2014 = 17 - 11 = 6 Cr

Difference between male and female population in 2015 = 11 - 9 = 2 Cr

Difference between male and female population in 2016 = 14 - 10 = 4 Cr

Hence, required difference is less than 4 Cr in the years 2011 and 2015.

question: Three circles of radius 14 cm are kept touching each other. The string is tightly tied around these three circles. What is the length of the string?
solution:
Here, r = 14 cm

Length of the strings = Circumference of the circle + 6r

= 2 * 22/7 * 14 + 6 * 14

= (88 + 84) cm

= 172 cm

question: There are two pipes P and Q attached to a tank. Pipe Q can empty the tank in 16 hours and pipe P can fill 3 litres of water in one minute. If the tank is full, and both pipes P and Q opened together, the tank will be emptied in 24 hours. What is the capacity of the tank?
solution:
Pipe Q can empty the tank in 16 hours.

Pipe P can fill the tank in = 1/(1/16 - 1/24) = 48 hours

Since pipe P can fill 3 litres of water in one minute.

So, amount of water filled by pipe P in 48 hours = 3 * 48 * 60 = 8640 litres

question: The average weight of 6 persons is increased by 2.50 kg when one of them weighing 45 kg is replaced by a new person. What is the weight of the new person?
solution:
Let the average weight = x

Weight of the new person = y

(x * 6 - 45 + y)/6 = x + 2.50

6x - 45 + y = 6x + 15

y = 60 kg

Express Method

Total increase in weight = 6 x 2.5 = 15 kg

Weight of the new person = 15 + 45 = 60 kg

question: The effective annual rate of compound interest corresponding to a nominal rate of 16% per annum payable half - yearly is:
solution:
Effective annual rate

Express Method

For half yearly, rate = 16/2 = 8%

Effective annual rate for 2 years = R + r + [(R + r)/100] = 8 + 8 + (8 x 8/100)=16.64%

question: Profit amount earned by a shopkeeper on selling an item at ₹1550 is six times the profit earned when it is sold at ₹925. At what price the item must be sold to incur loss of 5%?
solution:
Let CP of item = 'x'

According to the question:

(1550 - x) = 6 (925 - x)

1550 - x = 5550 - 6x

5x = 4000

x = 800

CP of item = ₹800

SP of item when sold at 5% loss = 95% of 800 = ₹760

100% = 360°

1% = 3.6°

43% = 3.6 * 43 = 154.8°

question: The marked price of an article is Rs.1800. A shopkeeper allows 15% discount on it and makes a profit of 53%. If he gives 5% discount instead of 15% on the same article, then what will be his profit percent?
solution:
Marked price = Rs.1800

Selling price of article = 1800 * 85/100 = Rs.1530

Cost price of article = 1530 * 100/153 = Rs.1000

New selling price of article = 1800 * 95/100 = Rs.1710

Profit% = (1710 - 1000) * 100/1000 = 710/10 = 71%.

question: A man travels 1/4 part of the journey at the speed of 40 km/h and rest part of the journey at the speed of 30 km/h. Find the average speed of the man.
solution:
Let total distance travelled by the man = 4d

Remaining part of journey = 1 - 1/4 = 3/4

Total time taken = (4d*1/4)/40 + (4d*3/4)/30

= d/40 + d/10

= d/8

Average speed = 4d/(d/8) = 32 km/h

question: Find the greatest 4 digits number which is completely divisible by 15, 25, 40 and 75.
solution:
The greatest number of 4 digits is 9999.

LCM of (15, 25, 40 and 75) = 600.

On dividing 9999 by 600 we get, the remainder = 399

Therefore, the required number = (9999 - 399) = 9600

question:
Table shows the number of male and female students who take admission in five different courses in a university.
CoursesNumber of male studentsNumber of female students
B.A450375
B.SC275195
BBA185150
B.TECH350420
B.ED390410

The total number of students who take admission in B.SC is what percent less than the total number of students who take admission in B.ED?
solution:
The total number of students who take admission in B.SC = 275 + 195 = 470

The total number of students who take admission in B.ED = 390 + 410 = 800

Required percentage = (800 - 470) * 100/800 = 330/8 = 41.25%

question: In a right angled ∆ABC with ∠B=90° an incircle in drawn. Find the diameter of incircle if AB=3 cm and BC=4 cm.
solution:
Given two sides are 3 cm and 4 cm.

Third side = √(32 + 42) = 5 cm

Inradius of circle = (base + perpendicular - hypotenuse)/2 = (3 + 4 - 5)/2 = 1 cm

Diameter of incircle = 2 * radius = 2 * 1 = 2 cm

question: Find the least value of S so that 12345S456 is divisible by 11.
solution:
According to the Question,

Number given = 12345S456

Sum of odd digits = 1+3+5+4+6=19

Sum of even digits =2+4+S+5=11+S

We know,

If a number is divisible by 11, then the difference in, 'sum of its odd place digits' and 'sum of its even place digits' is eighter 0 or divisible by 11.

So, 19-11-S = 0

S=8 Ans.

question: The side of an equilateral triangle is 4√3 cm. What is the radius of the circle inscribed in this equilateral triangle?
solution:
Side of equilateral triangle = 4√3 cm

Radius of the circle inscribed in the equilateral triangle = (1/2√3) * side

= (4√3)/(2√3) = 2 cm

question: The total surface area of a right pyramid is 756√3 cm2 and its base is a regular Hexagon with side 12 cm. What is the slant height (in cm) of the pyramid?
solution:
Lateral Surface Area (LSA) of a pyramid = 1/2 * Base perimeter * Slant Height

And, Total Surface Area (TSA) of the Pyramid = LSA + Base Area

=> 756√3 = 1/2 * 6 * 12 * Slant Height + (3√3/2) * 122

=> 756√3 = 36 * Slant Height + 216√3

=> Slant Height = 540√3/36

=> Slant Height = 15√3 cm

question: In an election held between A and B, out of total number of registered voters 20% voters didn't cast their vote and 6.25% casted votes are invalid. If A received 54% of casted valid votes and difference between the votes received by A and B respectively is 720. Find the total number of registered voters
solution:
Let the total number of voters = 100X

Voters who didn't cast vote = (20)% of 100X=20x

Number of invalid votes =6.25% of 80X =5X

Total valid voters = 75X

Votes received by A = 54% of 75X

Votes received by B = 46% of 75X

Difference = (54 - 46)% of 75X = 720

8% of 75X = 720

X = (720 * 100 * 100)/(8 * 75)

X = 12000

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

There was a lot of deep dislike between the two doctors.
solution:
Antipathy: Strong, deep dislike

Sympathy: Simultaneously affected by similar feelings

Empathy: Mentally identifying oneself with another person or a thing

Pathetic: Something or someone makes you feel deep sadness or pity

Hence, option (a) is correct.

question:
The following sentence has been split into three segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. If the sentence is error free, mark 'No error' as your answer.

I am studying Gujarati since I was ten years old.
solution:
An action already started and still going on comes under the present perfect continuous tense.

Syntax - Subject+ has/ have + been+ verb 1st form +ing+ object + for/since+ time.

So, 'am studying' [present continuous tense] is replaced with 'have been studying' [present perfect continuous tense].

The correct sentence is - "I have been studying Gujarati since I was ten years old."

Hence, option (b) is correct.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

This is one of the best films that has been published last year.
solution:
We cannot use the present perfect tense with 'last year', or 'last week'. These actions were completed in the past. So, the past simple tense should be used in such cases. The construct 'one of' is followed by a plural noun/noun phrase and a singular verb. So, the present perfect tense 'has been published' should be replaced with 'was published' to rectify the given sentence. Therefore, the error is in the segment in option (a). Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: This is one of the best films that was published last year.

question:
Select the appropriate option to replace the underlined word with the adverb of time.

Shrinkhala, who was occasionally a teacher, is now pursuing a career in writing.
solution:
In the given sentence, the speaker is describing Shrinkhala's past occupation as a teacher. The word "occasionally" implies that Shrinkhala worked as a teacher on certain occasions but not consistently. However, since the question asks for an adverb of time, "occasionally" should be replaced with an appropriate adverb of time. Option (d) "Formerly" is the best choice as it indicates that Shrinkhala previously worked as a teacher. Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

The rest of the options are adverbs of frequency.

The final sentence would be: Shrinkhala, who was formerly a teacher, is now pursuing a career in writing.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to improve the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to improve it, select 'No improvement'.

Many species have pouch to held their babies and food.
solution:
The infinitive maker 'to' is always followed by a base verb. The verb 'held' is the past form of the verb 'hold'. So, the highlighted part of the sentence is incorrect. The sentence already contains the verb 'have'. So, an additional verb [without any preposition to link the parts of the sentence] is not required in the noun clause of this sentence. Hence, option (a) is eliminated. The possessive pronoun 'theirs' is equivalent to 'their + noun'. A noun (babies) is already defined in the sentence. So, the possessive pronoun 'theirs' is grammatically incorrect. Hence, option (c) is eliminated. Option (b) satisfies all the grammatical conditions mentioned above. Hence, option (b) is the correct answer.

NOTE/-

Infinitive marker: A word or affix attached to the stem of a verb in order to form the full infinitive. In English, to is the infinitive marker.

Infinitive: The infinitive is the base form of a verb, often preceded by to. Consider the sentences given below: · To err is human. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to err' is the subject of the verb 'is'] · My father likes to cook. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to cook' is the object of the verb 'likes'] · To vote in elections is our right. [the infinitive 'to vote', like a noun, is the subject of the verb 'is', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (elections)] · Radha went to the lake to fetch water. [the infinitive 'to fetch', like a noun, is the object of the verb 'went', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (water)] · The above sentences illustrate various ways in which infinitives are used. It can both act as a noun and a verb.

Possessive Pronouns: The pronouns mine, yours, hers, his, ours, and theirs are known as possessive pronouns: they refer to something owned by the speaker or by someone or something previously mentioned. For example: The pen is mine.

question:
Select the option that will improve the underlined part of the given sentence. In case no improvement is needed, select 'No improvement required'.

New technology are going to revolutionize everything we do.
solution:
The plural verb 'are' does not agree with the singular subject 'technology'. The singular verb 'is' should replace 'are'.

Hence, the answer is option b).

Note:-

Subject-Verb Agreement: Matching up singular or plural subjects with singular or plural forms of a verb is part of the process called agreement. This can be understood better by the examples given: - "She likes cooking." [singular subject and verb] -- "They like to cook vegetables." [plural subject and verb]

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

In the vast desert, the travellers were grateful for the abundance of water in the oasis.
solution:
Abundance: a large quantity of something.

Scarcity: lack of something.

Variety: a range of different things.

Excess: an amount that is more than necessary.

Plenty: a large or sufficient amount.

Among the given options, the word 'scarcity' is opposite in meaning to the word 'abundance'. So, the two words can be used as antonyms of each other.

Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate SYNONYM of the following word in the given sentence and choose the correct option.

Inquisitive

The curious child asked endless questions, wanting to learn about the world around him.
solution: The word "inquisitive" describes someone who is eager to learn, and asks many questions to satisfy their curiosity. "Curious" means eager to know or learn something, which is synonymous with "inquisitive". Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

question:
Rearrange the jumbled words and choose the alternative that correctly matches the given sentence.

Wild cats __________________________ cats.

than / are / often / energetic and / more / domestic / aggressive
option_1: energetic and more domestic than are often aggressive
option_2: energetic and more aggressive are often than domestic
option_3: are often more domestic energetic and aggressive than
option_4: are often more energetic and aggressive than domestic
solution:
The correct option is d) are often more energetic and aggressive than domestic.

"are often": This is the correct word order for the subject and verb, indicating a common or frequent characteristic of wild cats.

"more energetic and aggressive": These adjectives describe the wild cats, showing that they are more energetic and aggressive compared to domestic cats.

"than domestic": The comparison is made with domestic cats, so "than" is used to indicate the difference between wild and domestic cats.

The complete sentence is: Wild cats are often more energetic and aggressive than domestic cats.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word 'resolve' from the following sentence.

Legislators are meeting this week to settle differences in versions of the budget.
solution:
Resolve - settle or find a solution to (a problem or contentious matter).

So, 'settle' is its synonym.

Hence, option (b) is the answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The car is being driven by Mark.
option_1: Mark is being driving the car.
option_3: Mark shall be driving the car.
option_4: Mark has been driving the car.
solution:
The changes that happen while converting a Passive voice to an Active voice sentence are: the Subject in the Passive voice becomes the Object in the Active voice and the Object in the Passive voice will become the Subject in the Active voice.

The tense of the sentence in the Passive voice remains the same in the Active voice too. In this Passive voice sentence, the tense is Present Continuous tense.

The helping verb and the preposition 'by' should be removed while changing from Passive voice to Active voice.

The Passive voice format is Object of the Active voice (Subjective case) + am/is/are + being + V3 + by + Subject of the Active voice (Objective case).

The Active voice format is Subject + is/am/ are+ Verb(ing) + Object.

For example:

The story is being narrated by the author. (Passive voice)

The author is narrating the story. (Active voice)

From the given options, the one that follows the above-mentioned conditions is option (b), "Mark is driving the car".

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

I gifted a soft toy to my daughter.
option_1: A soft toy is gifted to my daughter by me.
option_2: To my daughter was gifted a soft toy by me.
option_3: A soft toy was gifted to my daughter by me.
option_4: A soft toy was being gifted to my daughter by me.
solution:
The given sentence in active voice is in simple past tense. So, the sentence in passive voice should also be in simple past tense.

Format for Active voice: Subject + V2 + Object.

Format for Passive voice: Object of active voice + was/were + V3 + Subject of active voice.

So, the correct sentence in passive voice is: A soft toy was gifted to my daughter by me.

Hence, option (c) is the answer.

question:
From among the words given in bold, select the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the following sentence.

But the darkness of night was beginning to yeild to the pale tints of early dawn.
solution:
The word in option (b) has been incorrectly spelt. The correct spelling is 'yield'. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

'Night' means the period between sunset and sunrise.

'Yield' means to give as required.

'Darkness' means the state of lack of light.

'Dawn' means the morning twilight period immediately before sunrise.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Optional
solution:
'Optional' means left to personal choice. 'Compulsory' means required or mandatory. So, the two words can be used as antonyms of each other. Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

'Real' means actually existing.

'Chaos' means any state of disorder.

'Negative' means not positive or neutral.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Novice
solution:
Beginner- a person just starting to learn a skill or take part in an activity.

Veteran- a person who has had long experience in a particular field.

Pacifier- a person or thing that pacifies someone or something.

Supervisee- one who is supervised, and works under a supervisor.

The meaning of the word 'novice' is 'a person new to and inexperienced in a job or situation'. Among the options, the word that is opposite in meaning to the given word is option (b), 'veteran'.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

The short hemline is very much in vogue this spring.
solution:
Vogue - the prevailing fashion or style at a particular time.

Style - refers more broadly to a particular design, form, or manner of expression.

Both words have similar meanings. So, "style" is the required synonym.

Hence, option (a) is the answer.

Difficulty - a thing that is hard to accomplish, deal with, or understand.

Loss - the fact or process of losing something or someone.

Feedback - information about reactions to a product, a person's performance of a task, etc. which is used as a basis for improvement.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

High spirits
solution:
The idiom 'High spirits' means lively and cheerful behaviour or mood. Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

Usage: The team returned in high spirits.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]:In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Food security is crucial for ensuring (1) _____economies and healthy populations worldwide. Access to nutritious food not only (2)______ physical health but also supports mental well-being and productivity. Countries strive to (3)_____ food security by promoting sustainable agriculture, ensuring fair distribution networks, and implementing policies that safeguard against food shortages and price (4)_____. In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or economic downturns, food security becomes even more critical to prevent hunger and social unrest. By prioritizing food security, nations can foster resilience, promote economic growth, and (5)_____ basic human rights for all their citizens.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 1.
solution: The most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 1 is 'stable'. 'Stable' means firm, secure, or not likely to change or fail. In the context of the sentence, 'stable' indicates that food security is crucial for ensuring steady economies and healthy populations worldwide. The other options do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Fickle' means likely to change frequently, 'precarious' means dangerous or risky, and 'risky' means involving the possibility of something bad happening. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]:In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Food security is crucial for ensuring (1) _____economies and healthy populations worldwide. Access to nutritious food not only (2)______ physical health but also supports mental well-being and productivity. Countries strive to (3)_____ food security by promoting sustainable agriculture, ensuring fair distribution networks, and implementing policies that safeguard against food shortages and price (4)_____. In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or economic downturns, food security becomes even more critical to prevent hunger and social unrest. By prioritizing food security, nations can foster resilience, promote economic growth, and (5)_____ basic human rights for all their citizens.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 2.
solution: The most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 2 is 'sustains'. 'Sustains' means to support, uphold, or maintain. In the context of the sentence, this word accurately reflects the idea that nutritious food contributes to maintaining and supporting overall health and well-being. The other options do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Interrogates' means to ask questions or queries, 'explores' means to examine or investigate, and 'probes' means to investigate deeply or thoroughly. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]:In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Food security is crucial for ensuring (1) _____economies and healthy populations worldwide. Access to nutritious food not only (2)______ physical health but also supports mental well-being and productivity. Countries strive to (3)_____ food security by promoting sustainable agriculture, ensuring fair distribution networks, and implementing policies that safeguard against food shortages and price (4)_____. In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or economic downturns, food security becomes even more critical to prevent hunger and social unrest. By prioritizing food security, nations can foster resilience, promote economic growth, and (5)_____ basic human rights for all their citizens.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 3.
solution: The most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 3 is 'achieve'. 'Achieve' means to successfully reach or accomplish something. In the context of the sentence, this word accurately reflects the efforts countries make to ensure food security. The other options do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Steal' means to take without permission, 'divert' means to change the direction or course of something, and 'please' means to make someone happy or satisfied. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]:In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Food security is crucial for ensuring (1) _____economies and healthy populations worldwide. Access to nutritious food not only (2)______ physical health but also supports mental well-being and productivity. Countries strive to (3)_____ food security by promoting sustainable agriculture, ensuring fair distribution networks, and implementing policies that safeguard against food shortages and price (4)_____. In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or economic downturns, food security becomes even more critical to prevent hunger and social unrest. By prioritizing food security, nations can foster resilience, promote economic growth, and (5)_____ basic human rights for all their citizens.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 4.
solution: The most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 4 is 'volatility'. 'Volatility' refers to the quality or state of being unstable or fluctuating unpredictably. In the context of the sentence, "volatility" conveys the idea of unpredictability or instability in food prices. The other options do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Lethargy' means lack of energy or enthusiasm, 'telepathy' means communication between minds without the use of sensory perceptions, and 'partiality' means bias or favouritism. Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]:In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Food security is crucial for ensuring (1) _____economies and healthy populations worldwide. Access to nutritious food not only (2)______ physical health but also supports mental well-being and productivity. Countries strive to (3)_____ food security by promoting sustainable agriculture, ensuring fair distribution networks, and implementing policies that safeguard against food shortages and price (4)_____. In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or economic downturns, food security becomes even more critical to prevent hunger and social unrest. By prioritizing food security, nations can foster resilience, promote economic growth, and (5)_____ basic human rights for all their citizens.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 5.
solution: The most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 5 is 'uphold'. 'Uphold' means to support, maintain, or defend something, especially principles or rights. In the context of the sentence, this word accurately reflects the idea that ensuring food security supports and defends the fundamental rights of people to have access to nutritious food. The other options do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Flatter' means praise excessively, 'renovate' means repair or improve something, and 'demolish' means completely destroy something. Hence, (d) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the boldened idiom.

She knew it was time to face the music and accept responsibility for her actions.
solution: The idiom "face the music" means to accept the unpleasant consequence/reality. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

question:
Complete the following collocation.

The documentary based on historical events was a ____ disappointment.
solution:
The adjective which is generally used with the noun 'disappointment' is 'big'. Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

The final sentence would be: The documentary based on historical events was a big disappointment.
